document.docAuthor: Sharkey, Michael J., Chapman, Eric G., Janzen, Daniel H., Hallwachs, Winnie & Smith, M. Alex
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Aphelagathis (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Agathidinae, Agathidini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Aphelagathis (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Agathidinae, Agathidini)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . The only species with a predominantly black head.

Description . Body length 7.4 . Fore wing length 7.2 . Ovipositor length 4.6 . Body color black and yellow/ orange; black as follows: head except posterior orbit, body of thorax s.s. except metapleuron, fore leg, and mid leg except coxa, hind leg at base and apex of tibia and all tarsomeres (one specimen (
Fig. 4
D) has most of propodeum and metapleuron melanic). 53 flagellomeres. Fore wing deeply and evenly infuscate. Propodeum mostly smooth laterally, medially with a rugose ridge that bifurcates posteriorly forming an irregular small cell. Cub of hind wing well pigmented.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4 .
Aphelagathis ericgrisselli
holotype ♀ (except paratype in D). A. hind tarsal claw. B. lateral habitus. C. dorsal habitus. D. lateral mesosoma of melanic paratype. E. wings (hind wing not to scale). F. lateral head and mesosoma. G. propodeum

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . Named in honor of Dr E. Eric Grissell, former chalcidologist with U.S. National Museum of Natural History, in recognition of our friendship and of his many contributions to hymenopterology.
